sentences.sContent: As he thought it over, his anger gradually dissipated.
sentences.sCn: 他想明白后，怒气就渐渐消了。

sentences.sContent: Little by little, the smoke was dissipated by the breeze.
sentences.sCn: 在微风的吹拂下烟雾渐渐地消散了。

remMethod.val: dis(不) ＋ sip(小口喝) ＋ ate(吃) → 不是小口吃 → 大吃大喝 → 挥霍

words.tran: 消散的；沉迷于酒色的；闲游浪荡的；放荡的

trans.tranOther: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this

trans.tranCn: 使消散， 使消失； 浪费， 挥霍
trans.tranOther: to gradually become less or weaker before disappearing completely, or to make something do this
